resources.string: Increace quantity of stages up to:
The changes will change after the application is restarted

"
Need to specify the passport characteristics of the pump sections. It is recommended to specify data for the BOP of the pump. "

" Enter the total lengths used in the lift of tubing pipes, as well as their types. You can enter no more than three types of pipe sizes. For next calculations, enter at least one section of the tubing pipe.
Fill in the sizes used in the lift, starting from the top section. "

"
For calculations, two main parameters must be entered: static or dynamic level, head pressure. If the level is unknown, but the data of the submersible gauge of the ESP are available, additional data must be enter to calculate the level: the pump intake pressure, the casing pressure and the density of the liquid. After entering all these data, the level in the well will be calculated automatically. It is also necessary to take into account that the calculation of the liquid level is performed for a vertical well. "

" BEP line - is a line of best pump efficiency.
TDH - total dynamic head.
The calculation is performed for a vertical well and degassed liquid at an operating frequency of 35-70 Hz. The data at the efficiency point is taken from the previously entered pump data. The calculations will also be relevant for data not at the BEP (left or right zones), which you can enter in the pump characteristics. In this case, the calculation description will continue to be displayed as for the BEP, but it won't be right. "

"
Recommendations provided for the operation of the ESP at the BEP. To recalculate the data, according to the recommendations, you can change the operating frequency. When changing the number of pump stages, also change the pressure value. "

To calculate the volume of fluid in the well, it is necessary to enter a static or dynamic level. If this level is not known, it will be calculated automatically when entering the data of the downhole sensor. The entered level should not exceed the total length of the tubing. Also, the value of fluid level is automatically recalculated depending on the change in the length of tubing to match the readings of the downhole gauge. "

It is necessary to select the types and lengths of the production column pipes used in the well. For calculations, the length of the pipes of the production column should not be less than the length of the tubing entered earlier. Enter the length values according to the prompts for the remainder of the length. Data on the production column pipe must be entered from top to bottom, according to the well diagram. Also, the program will not allow you to enter the length of the pipe of the production column more than the length of the tubing, since the excess length will not take part in further calculations. "

Here calculations provided of the volumes of pipes used.
The volume of fluid is calculated as the sum of the volume of fluid inside the tubing, and the volume of fluid between the pipe of the production column and the tubing. "
Enter nominal characteristics values of the electrical motor.
Select and enter characteristics of the cable. You can enter no more than three types of the cable. For next calculations, enter at least one fields.
Enter base frequency of the station and output voltage for base frequency.
Enter nominal characteristics values for transformer. U(lvs) – voltage for low side of transformer.
Enter necessary power reserve for surface equipment.
Enter nominal characteristics values of the electrical motor
Select and enter characteristics of the cable. You can enter no more than three types of the cable. For next calculations, enter at least one fields.
Enter base and operation frequency of the station. Enter output voltage for base frequency.
Enter nominal characteristics values for transformer. U(lvs) – voltage for low side of transformer.

The voltage that comes to the motor is calculated, taking into account the losses on surface electrical equipment and cable. The calculation is made by the selection method under the following conditions:
- to start up the motor, a voltage of at least 50-55% of the nominal is required;
- the excess of the startup current at a motor voltage of 50-55% of the nominal should be no more than 2.5-3 times.
Thus, the intersection point on the graphs is the calculated voltage that comes to the motor.
The actual motor startup depends on many factors and conditions. Treat this calculation as a preliminary assessment.

"

"
The level exceeds the length of the pipes
Need stop the timer before clean the comissioning field.
The level should not be greater than the length of the tubings.

Clicking on the input field opens a dialog box. In this window, you must enter the level of liquid in the well. If the level is not known, use additional fields, after filling in which the level will be calculated automatically. Calculations are made for a vertical well.

Enter the time of appearance of the liquid in minutes after the start of the ESP. The time can be filled in automatically when using the built-in timer, which is started by pressing the "Commission" button.
Also enter the level of liquid in the well. If the level is not known, use additional fields, after filling in which the level will be calculated automatically. Calculations are made for a vertical well.

Enter values of the liquid level and the waiting time for the measurement activity are similar to the recommendations in previous commission activities. Also enter the volume or the measured flow rate. The "Volume" and "Debit" fields are mutually recalculated when the "Waiting time" field is filled in. Calculations are made for a vertical well.
Like the heart of a loved one
